titleStmt.title: George Webster to James F. Robinson
CWG8563

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: To his Exellency Governor Robinson of Kentucky.

The undersigned Citizen and Freeholders of the City of Newport, Campbell County, Ky, respectfully represent that at the Aug. ^1862^ term of the Campbell Circuit Court, C. Redinger was found guilty of the offense of selling liquor to Minors and was accordingly fined fifty dollars and costs; They further represent that the said C. Redinger is respectfullable but poor and law abiding Citizen of said city, that he was convicted upon the evidence of a young man who was apparently over the age of twenty-one and who really was only one or two months under that age.
Considering the above stated facts they respectfully pray your Exellency to remit the Commonwealths portion of the fine in the above case.

Geo P Webster
Ira Root
J Hawthorn
Geo R Francis
J C. Cline
Robt B. MCrackin
Mayor of Newport
E. W. Hawkins
Joseph Paul
A. S. Claypool
S. Geisler

Pettn of Redinger for rem of fine
Exd & referred
